A2 having good things happen to you by chance: "I'm going to Japan." "Lucky you!" The lucky winner will be able to choose from three different holidays. [ + to infinitive ] They're lucky to have such a nice office to work in. He's lucky that he wasn't fired. It sounds as if you had a lucky escape (= by good chance you were able to avoid something dangerous or unpleasant). We'll be lucky if we get there by midnight at this rate (= we might get there by midnight or it might be later).
